trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory - Terminology
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory - Terminology

trans-unit.source: This article introduces you to the terminology used in creating data factories using the Azure Data Factory service
trans-unit.target: This article introduces you to the terminology used in creating data factories using the Azure Data Factory service

trans-unit.source: An Azure data factory has one or more pipelines that process data in linked data stores (Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, on-premises SQL Server etc...) by using linked compute services such as Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: An Azure data factory has one or more pipelines that process data in linked data stores (Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, on-premises SQL Server etc...) by using linked compute services such as Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: An Azure data factory itself does not contain data within it; The data is rather stored in data stores mentioned above.
trans-unit.target: An Azure data factory itself does not contain data within it; The data is rather stored in data stores mentioned above.

trans-unit.source: A linked service is a service that is linked to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: A linked service is a service that is linked to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: A linked service can be one of the following:
trans-unit.target: A linked service can be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: A data storage service such as Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database or on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: A data storage service such as Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database or on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: A data store is a container of input/output data sets.
trans-unit.target: A data store is a container of input/output data sets.

trans-unit.source: A compute service such as Azure HDInsight, Azure Machine Learning, and Azure Batch.
trans-unit.target: A compute service such as Azure HDInsight, Azure Machine Learning, and Azure Batch.

trans-unit.source: A compute service process the input data and produces the output data.
trans-unit.target: A compute service process the input data and produces the output data.

trans-unit.source: A data set is a named view of data.
trans-unit.target: A data set is a named view of data.

trans-unit.source: The data being described can vary from simple bytes, semi-structured data like CSV files all the way up to relational tables or even models.
trans-unit.target: The data being described can vary from simple bytes, semi-structured data like CSV files all the way up to relational tables or even models.

trans-unit.source: A Data Factory table is a data set that has a schema and is rectangular.
trans-unit.target: A Data Factory table is a data set that has a schema and is rectangular.

trans-unit.source: After creating a linked service in a data store that refers to a data store, you define data sets that represent input/output data that is stored in the data store.
trans-unit.target: After creating a linked service in a data store that refers to a data store, you define data sets that represent input/output data that is stored in the data store.

trans-unit.source: A pipeline in an Azure data factory processes data in linked storage services by using linked compute services.
trans-unit.target: A pipeline in an Azure data factory processes data in linked storage services by using linked compute services.

trans-unit.source: It contains a sequence of activities where each activity performing a specific processing operation.
trans-unit.target: It contains a sequence of activities where each activity performing a specific processing operation.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Copy Activity copies data from a source storage to a destination storage and HDInsight Activity use an Azure HDInsight cluster to process data using Hive queries or Pig scripts.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Copy Activity copies data from a source storage to a destination storage and HDInsight Activity use an Azure HDInsight cluster to process data using Hive queries or Pig scripts.

trans-unit.source: A data factory can have one or more pipelines.
trans-unit.target: A data factory can have one or more pipelines.

trans-unit.source: Typical steps for creating an Azure Data Factory instance are:
trans-unit.target: Typical steps for creating an Azure Data Factory instance are:

trans-unit.source: Create a data factory.
trans-unit.target: Create a data factory.

trans-unit.source: Create a linked service for each data store or compute service.
trans-unit.target: Create a linked service for each data store or compute service.

trans-unit.source: Create input and output datasets.
trans-unit.target: Create input and output datasets.

trans-unit.source: Create a pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Create a pipeline.

trans-unit.source: A data processing step in a pipeline that takes one or more input datasets and produces one or more output datasets.
trans-unit.target: A data processing step in a pipeline that takes one or more input datasets and produces one or more output datasets.

trans-unit.source: Activities run in an execution environment (for example: Azure HDInsight cluster) and read/write data to a data store associated/linked with the Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: Activities run in an execution environment (for example: Azure HDInsight cluster) and read/write data to a data store associated/linked with the Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory service supports the following activities in a pipeline:
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory service supports the following activities in a pipeline:

trans-unit.source: Copy Activity copies the data from a data store to another data store.
trans-unit.target: Copy Activity copies the data from a data store to another data store.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Activity processes data by running Hive/Pig scripts or MapReduce programs on an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Activity processes data by running Hive/Pig scripts or MapReduce programs on an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity invokes the Azure Machine Learning batch scoring API.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity invokes the Azure Machine Learning batch scoring API.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Create Predictive Pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Azure Machine Learning[azure-ml-adf]</linkText><title></title> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Create Predictive Pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Azure Machine Learning[azure-ml-adf]</linkText><title></title> for details.

trans-unit.source: Stored Procedure Activity invokes a stored procedure in an Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Stored Procedure Activity invokes a stored procedure in an Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Stored Procedure Activity[msdn-stored-procedure-activity]</linkText><title></title> on MSDN Library for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Stored Procedure Activity[msdn-stored-procedure-activity]</linkText><title></title> on MSDN Library for details.

trans-unit.source: A table in an Azure data factory is composed of slices.
trans-unit.target: A table in an Azure data factory is composed of slices.

trans-unit.source: The width of a slice is determined by the schedule – hourly/daily.
trans-unit.target: The width of a slice is determined by the schedule – hourly/daily.

trans-unit.source: When the schedule is “hourly”, a slice is produced hourly with in the start time and end time of a pipeline.
trans-unit.target: When the schedule is “hourly”, a slice is produced hourly with in the start time and end time of a pipeline.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the pipeline start date-time is 03/03/2015 06:00:00 (6 AM) and end date-time is 03-03/2015 09:00:00 (9 AM on the same day), three data slices are produced, a slice for each 1 hour interval: 6-7 AM, 7-8 AM, and 8-9 AM.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the pipeline start date-time is 03/03/2015 06:00:00 (6 AM) and end date-time is 03-03/2015 09:00:00 (9 AM on the same day), three data slices are produced, a slice for each 1 hour interval: 6-7 AM, 7-8 AM, and 8-9 AM.

trans-unit.source: Slices provide the ability to work with a subset of overall data for a specific time window (for example: the slice that is produced for the duration (hour): 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM).
trans-unit.target: Slices provide the ability to work with a subset of overall data for a specific time window (for example: the slice that is produced for the duration (hour): 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM).

trans-unit.source: The run or an activity run is a unit of processing for a slice.
trans-unit.target: The run or an activity run is a unit of processing for a slice.

trans-unit.source: There could be one or more runs for a slice in case of retries or if you rerun your slice in case of a failure.
trans-unit.target: There could be one or more runs for a slice in case of retries or if you rerun your slice in case of a failure.

trans-unit.source: A slice is identified by its start time.
trans-unit.target: A slice is identified by its start time.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Data Management Gateway is software that connects on-premises data sources to cloud services for consumption.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Data Management Gateway is software that connects on-premises data sources to cloud services for consumption.

trans-unit.source: You must have at least one gateway installed in your corporate environment and register it with the Azure Data Factory portal before adding on-premises data sources as linked services.
trans-unit.target: You must have at least one gateway installed in your corporate environment and register it with the Azure Data Factory portal before adding on-premises data sources as linked services.

trans-unit.source: A Data Hub is a logical container for data storage and compute services.
trans-unit.target: A Data Hub is a logical container for data storage and compute services.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Hadoop cluster with HDFS as storage and Hive/Pig as compute (processing) is a data hub.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Hadoop cluster with HDFS as storage and Hive/Pig as compute (processing) is a data hub.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, an enterprise data warehouse (EDW) can be modeled as a data hub (database as storage, stored procedures and/or ETL tool as compute services).
trans-unit.target: Similarly, an enterprise data warehouse (EDW) can be modeled as a data hub (database as storage, stored procedures and/or ETL tool as compute services).

trans-unit.source: Pipelines use data stores and run on compute resources in a data hub.
trans-unit.target: Pipelines use data stores and run on compute resources in a data hub.

trans-unit.source: Only HDInsight hub is supported at this moment.
trans-unit.target: Only HDInsight hub is supported at this moment.

trans-unit.source: The Data Hub allows a data factory to be divided into logical or domain specific groupings, such as the “West US Azure Hub” which manages all of the linked services (data stores and compute) and pipelines focused in the West US data center, or the “Sales EDW Hub” which manages all the linked services and pipelines concerned with populating and processing data for the Sales Enterprise Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: The Data Hub allows a data factory to be divided into logical or domain specific groupings, such as the “West US Azure Hub” which manages all of the linked services (data stores and compute) and pipelines focused in the West US data center, or the “Sales EDW Hub” which manages all the linked services and pipelines concerned with populating and processing data for the Sales Enterprise Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: An important characteristic of Hub is that a pipeline runs on a single hub.
trans-unit.target: An important characteristic of Hub is that a pipeline runs on a single hub.

trans-unit.source: This means that when defining a pipeline, all of the linked services referenced by tables or activities within that pipeline must have the same hub name as the pipeline itself.
trans-unit.target: This means that when defining a pipeline, all of the linked services referenced by tables or activities within that pipeline must have the same hub name as the pipeline itself.

trans-unit.source: If the HubName property is not specified for a linked service, the linked service is placed in the “Default” Hub.
trans-unit.target: If the HubName property is not specified for a linked service, the linked service is placed in the “Default” Hub.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Introduction to Azure Data Factory[adf-intro]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Introduction to Azure Data Factory[adf-intro]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of the Azure Data Factory service, the value it provides, and the scenarios it supports.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of the Azure Data Factory service, the value it provides, and the scenarios it supports.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get started with Data Factory[datafactory-getstarted]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This article provides an end-to-end tutorial that shows you how to create a sample Azure data factory that copies data from an Azure blob to an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an end-to-end tutorial that shows you how to create a sample Azure data factory that copies data from an Azure blob to an Azure SQL database.
